data.question: What is the empirical formula of UiO(bpdc)?
What method was used to activate the as-synthesized sample of UiO(bpdc) for adsorption measurements?
What is the BET surface area of UiO(bpdc) calculated from the N2 adsorption isotherm at 77 K?
How does the uptake ratio of D2 to H2 change with pressure at 77 K?
data.answer: The uptake ratio of D2 to H2 shows an increasing trend with decreasing pressure and reaches a maximum ratio of 1.19 at 20 mbar.

data.question: What is the predicated methane storage capacity of UiO(bpdc) at 293 K and 35 bar?
What phenomenon is observed in the adsorption isotherms of CO2 at 195 K and organic solvents at room temperature for UiO(bpdc)?
data.answer: Unusual reversible stepwise isotherms are observed.

data.question: What is the role of Soxhlet-extraction in the activation of UiO(bpdc)?
data.answer: Soxhlet-extraction is used to fully evacuate the as synthesized sample by extracting the high boiling point solvents and other compounds involved in the framework.

data.question: Why does UiO(bpdc) exhibit high uptake capacities for H2, CO2, and CH4?
data.answer: The high uptake capacities are due to the highly porous structure combined with Lewis basic sites incorporated on the pore surface.

data.question: How does the incorporation of Lewis basic bipyridyl sites in UiO(bpdc) affect its gas adsorption properties?
data.answer: The incorporation of Lewis basic bipyridyl sites enhances the gas uptake capacities by anchoring the Lewis basic sites onto the pore surface without sacrificing its original high porosity and exceptional robustness.

data.question: What is the significance of the stepwise isotherms observed for UiO(bpdc)?
data.answer: The stepwise isotherms indicate a sequential filling mechanism of adsorbates on different adsorption sites.

data.question: Is the BET surface area of UiO(bpdc) higher than that of UiO-67?
Does the Soxhlet-extraction process decrease the pore volume of UiO(bpdc)?
Is the predicated methane storage capacity of UiO(bpdc) below the DOE target for methane storage at ambient temperature and 35 bar?
Are the stepwise adsorption isotherms for UiO(bpdc) caused by pore expansion and contraction?
Is the isosteric adsorption enthalpy (Qst) of CO2 on UiO(bpdc) higher than that on MIL-101?
Does the uptake ratio of D2 to H2 decrease with decreasing pressure at 77 K?
Is the chemical stability of UiO(bpdc) compromised when exposed to moisture and common solvents?
